subject: Art & Design
title: Cultural Appropriation vs. Appreciation in Fashion
description: A quick, practical guide to Cultural Appropriation vs. Appreciation in Fashion.

hook.text: Gucci sold a $790 'turban.' Sikh communities pointed out they wear turbans as religious practice.

buildup.text: Cultural appropriation occurs when dominant cultures borrow elements from marginalized ones without credit, context.

discovery.text: The line between appreciation and appropriation: credit, collaboration, and whether the originating culture benefits.

twist.text: Fashion has always mixed cultures. The question isn't whether to borrow ‚Äî it's how, and who profits.

climax.text: Brands like Dior now collaborate with indigenous artisans, sharing profits and credit. The model is evolving.

punchline.text: Appreciation asks. Appropriation takes. The difference is respect.

quiz.question: What distinguishes cultural appreciation from cultural appropriation in fashion?
options: Credit, collaboration, and whether the originating culture benefits
Only the price of the garment matters
Any cultural mixing is automatically appropriation
